abstract.p: Gov George E Pataki will formally announce corporate moves expected to take 300 jobs to former Ciba-Geigy headquarters in Greenburgh when he appears in Westchester County community on April 10 to accept award for leadership in county's economic revival (S)

block.p: Gov. George E. Pataki is to formally announce corporate moves expected to take 300 jobs to the former Ciba-Geigy headquarters in Greenburgh when he appears in the Westchester County community today to accept an award for leadership in the county's economic revival.

In one of the moves, Cultor Food Science Inc., a Finnish food conglomerate, is to transfer 170 jobs from Groton, Conn., and Manhattan to 100,000 square feet of space in the former Ciba-Geigy office at the Ardsley Park Science and Technology Center in Greenburgh. Cultor Food Science plans to invest $23 million in Ardsley Park.

Gov. George E. Pataki is to formally announce corporate moves expected to take 300 jobs to the former Ciba-Geigy headquarters in Greenburgh when he appears in the Westchester County community today to accept an award for leadership in the county's economic revival.

In one of the moves, Cultor Food Science Inc., a Finnish food conglomerate, is to transfer 170 jobs from Groton, Conn., and Manhattan to 100,000 square feet of space in the former Ciba-Geigy office at the Ardsley Park Science and Technology Center in Greenburgh. Cultor Food Science plans to invest $23 million in Ardsley Park.

In the other move, Purdue Pharma LP, an over-the-counter pharmaceutical company based in Norwalk, Conn., is to transfer 130 jobs from Yonkers to a new research and development office in a 105,000-square-foot laboratory building on the 460,000-square foot Ardsley campus. The company plans to invest $14.7 million in capital improvements to its property.

At today's gathering, the Governor is also to confer awards on four Westchester companies for their commitment to New York State. They are the Swiss Re Corporation, the Nine West Group, NewRoc Associates LP and the Spraylat Corporation.
